methods.filter:
Filter selection to only matching rows.

:param selection: (io.deephaven.engine.rowset.RowSet) - the indices that should be filtered. The selection must be a subset of fullSet, and may include
        rows that the engine determines need not be evaluated to produce the result. Implementations may
        not mutate or close selection.
:param fullSet: (io.deephaven.engine.rowset.RowSet) - the complete RowSet of the table to filter. The fullSet is used for calculating variables like "i"
        or "ii". Implementations may not mutate or close fullSet.
:param table: (io.deephaven.engine.table.Table) - the table to filter
:param usePrev: (boolean) - true if previous values should be used. Implementing previous value filtering is optional, and a
        WhereFilter.PreviousFilteringNotSupported exception may be thrown. If a PreviousFiltering exception is thrown,
        then the caller must acquire the UpdateGraphProcessor lock.
:return: (io.deephaven.engine.rowset.WritableRowSet) The subset of selection accepted by this filter; ownership passes to the caller
methods.getColumnArrays:
Get the array columns required by this select filter.

:return: (java.util.List<java.lang.String>) the columns used as array input by this select filter.
methods.getColumns:
Get the columns required by this select filter.

:return: (java.util.List<java.lang.String>) the columns used as input by this select filter.
methods.init:
Initialize this select filter given the table definition

:param tableDefinition: (io.deephaven.engine.table.TableDefinition) - the definition of the table that will be filtered
methods.isRefreshing:
Is this filter refreshing?

:return: (boolean) if this filter is refreshing
methods.isSimpleFilter:
:return: (boolean) true if this is a filter that does not require any code execution, but rather is handled entirely within
         the database engine.
methods.setRecomputeListener:
Set the ShiftObliviousListener that should be notified if results based on this filter must be recomputed.

:param listener: (io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.select.WhereFilter.RecomputeListener) - the listener to notify.

text: Boilerplate super-class for various clock-oriented filters.
